Renderer
description:
en: This class take a role as operator of rendering process. In order to render images to canvas, this Renderer class gathers other elements' data, decides a plan of drawing process, and then just execute it.
ja: CanvasRenderer

name: draw
description:
en: draw elements of the scene.
ja: scene

name: clearCanvas
description:
en: clear color/depth/stencil of canvas.
ja: canvas

params.name: color_flg
params.description: true: clear color, false: don't clear color

params.name: depth_flg
params.description: true: clear depth, false: don't clear depth

params.name: stencil_flg
params.description: true: clear stencil, false: don't clear stencil

name: createTexturesForRenderTarget
description:
en: create textures as render target. (and attach it to framebuffer object internally.)
ja:framebuffer object

unknown.tagValue: {Array} en: an array of created textures. ja:

params.name: textureNum
params.description: en: the number of creation. ja:

return.description: en: an array of created textures. ja:

name: glContext
description:
en: Get WebGL context.
ja: WebGL

name: resize
description:
en: resize canvas and viewport.
ja: canvas

name: js/Scene.js
Scene
description:
en: This Scene class is the top level element of scene graph hierarchy. To render scene, pass this scene element to Renderer.draw method.
ja: Scene sceneRenderer.draw

name: add
description:
en: Add the element to this scene as a child.
ja: element

name: addChild
description:
en: Add the element to this scene as a child.
ja: element

name: getChildren
description:
en: Get child elements which belong to this scene.
ja:

return.description: en: child elements of this scene. ja:

name: setCurrentAnimationValue
description:
en: Set animation input value (for instance frame value), This value affect all child elements in this scene graph (recursively).
ja:

params.name: inputName
params.description: en: inputName name of input value. ja:

params.name: inputValue
params.description: en: input value of animation. ja:

name: prepareForRender
description:
en: Prepare for Rendering. You have to call this method before Renderer.draw method.
ja: Renderer.draw

name: elements
description:
en: Get child elements which belong to this scene.
ja:

return.description: en: child elements of this scene. ja:

name: meshes
description:
en: Get child meshes which belong to this scene.
ja: Mesh

return.description: en: child meshes of this scene. ja: Mesh

name: lights
description:
en: Get child lights which belong to this scene.
ja: Light

return.description: en: child lights of this scene. ja: Light

name: cameras
description:
en: Get child cameras which belong to this scene.
ja: Camera

return.description: en: child cameras of this scene. ja: Camera

js/primitives/Cube.js
content:
import GLBoost from './../globals'
import Geometry from './../Geometry'
import Vector4 from './../math/Vector4'
import Vector3 from './../math/Vector3'
import Vector2 from './../math/Vector2'

export default class Cube extends Geometry {
  constructor(widthVector, vertexColor, canvas = GLBoost.CURRENT_CANVAS_ID) {
    super(canvas);

    this._setupVertexData(widthVector.divide(2.0), vertexColor);
  }

  _setupVertexData(widthVector, vertexColor) {
    var indices = [
      3, 1, 0, 2, 1, 3,
      4, 5, 7, 7, 5, 6,
      8, 9, 11, 11, 9, 10,
      15, 13, 12, 14, 13, 15,
      19, 17, 16, 18, 17, 19,
      20, 21, 23, 23, 21, 22
    ];


    var positions = [
      // upper
      new Vector3(-widthVector.x, widthVector.y, -widthVector.z),
      new Vector3(widthVector.x,  widthVector.y, -widthVector.z),
      new Vector3(widthVector.x,  widthVector.y, widthVector.z),
      new Vector3(-widthVector.x, widthVector.y, widthVector.z),
      // lower
      new Vector3(-widthVector.x, -widthVector.y, -widthVector.z),
      new Vector3(widthVector.x,  -widthVector.y, -widthVector.z),
      new Vector3(widthVector.x,  -widthVector.y, widthVector.z),
      new Vector3(-widthVector.x, -widthVector.y, widthVector.z),
      // front
      new Vector3(-widthVector.x, -widthVector.y, widthVector.z),
      new Vector3(widthVector.x,  -widthVector.y, widthVector.z),
      new Vector3(widthVector.x,  widthVector.y, widthVector.z),
      new Vector3(-widthVector.x, widthVector.y, widthVector.z),
      // back
      new Vector3(-widthVector.x, -widthVector.y, -widthVector.z),
      new Vector3(widthVector.x,  -widthVector.y, -widthVector.z),
      new Vector3(widthVector.x,  widthVector.y, -widthVector.z),
      new Vector3(-widthVector.x, widthVector.y, -widthVector.z),
      // right
      new Vector3(widthVector.x, -widthVector.y, -widthVector.z),
      new Vector3(widthVector.x,  -widthVector.y, widthVector.z),
      new Vector3(widthVector.x,  widthVector.y, widthVector.z),
      new Vector3(widthVector.x, widthVector.y, -widthVector.z),
      // left
      new Vector3(-widthVector.x, -widthVector.y, -widthVector.z),
      new Vector3(-widthVector.x,  -widthVector.y, widthVector.z),
      new Vector3(-widthVector.x,  widthVector.y, widthVector.z),
      new Vector3(-widthVector.x, widthVector.y, -widthVector.z)
    ];
    var colors = [
      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),
      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),
      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),
      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),

      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),
      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),
      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),
      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),

      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),
      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),
      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),
      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),

      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),
      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),
      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),
      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),

      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),
      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),
      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),
      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),

      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),
      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),
      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w),
      new Vector4(vertexColor.x, vertexColor.y, vertexColor.z, vertexColor.w)
    ];
    var texcoords = [
      new Vector2(0.0, 0.0),
      new Vector2(1.0, 0.0),
      new Vector2(1.0, 1.0),
      new Vector2(0.0, 1.0),

      new Vector2(0.0, 0.0),
      new Vector2(1.0, 0.0),
      new Vector2(1.0, 1.0),
      new Vector2(0.0, 1.0),

      new Vector2(0.0, 0.0),
      new Vector2(1.0, 0.0),
      new Vector2(1.0, 1.0),
      new Vector2(0.0, 1.0),

      new Vector2(0.0, 0.0),
      new Vector2(1.0, 0.0),
      new Vector2(1.0, 1.0),
      new Vector2(0.0, 1.0),

      new Vector2(0.0, 0.0),
      new Vector2(1.0, 0.0),
      new Vector2(1.0, 1.0),
      new Vector2(0.0, 1.0),

      new Vector2(0.0, 0.0),
      new Vector2(1.0, 0.0),
      new Vector2(1.0, 1.0),
      new Vector2(0.0, 1.0)
    ];

    var normals = [
      // upper
      new Vector3(0, 1, 0),
      new Vector3(0, 1, 0),
      new Vector3(0, 1, 0),
      new Vector3(0, 1, 0),
      // lower
      new Vector3(0, -1, 0),
      new Vector3(0, -1, 0),
      new Vector3(0, -1, 0),
      new Vector3(0, -1, 0),
      // front
      new Vector3(0, 0, 1),
      new Vector3(0, 0, 1),
      new Vector3(0, 0, 1),
      new Vector3(0, 0, 1),
      // back
      new Vector3(0, 0, -1),
      new Vector3(0, 0, -1),
      new Vector3(0, 0, -1),
      new Vector3(0, 0, -1),
      // right
      new Vector3(1, 0, 0),
      new Vector3(1, 0, 0),
      new Vector3(1, 0, 0),
      new Vector3(1, 0, 0),
      // left
      new Vector3(-1, 0, 0),
      new Vector3(-1, 0, 0),
      new Vector3(-1, 0, 0),
      new Vector3(-1, 0, 0),
    ];

    this.setVerticesData({
      position: positions,
      color: colors,
      normal: normals,
      texcoord: texcoords
    }, [indices]);
  }

}

GLBoost["Cube"] = Cube;

name: js/primitives/Particle.js
Particle
description:
This Particle class handles particles expressions.
You can define particles behaviors in a custom vertex shader.
These particles are processed in GPU, so this is a very fast solution of particles expressions.

params.name: centerPointData
params.description: position array and the other data

params.name: JSON
params.description: which has other vertex attribute arrays you want

params.name: Canvas
params.description: Element which is generation source of WebGL context in current use or String which indicates the Canvas Element in jQuery like query string
